title: 108_hr2174
content: The "Educational Access for America's Soldiers Act of 2003" allows active-duty personnel to enroll under the Montgomery GI Bill. The "Educational Access for America's Soldiers Act of 2003" allows qualified active-duty personnel to make an irrevocable election to receive basic educational assistance under Chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code, within a one-year period. The Secretary of each military department will establish procedures for this election. Qualified active-duty personnel can receive educational assistance under Chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code, if they meet specific requirements. These include serving on active duty without a break since joining the Armed Forces before July 1, 1985, and completing secondary school education or equivalent certification before applying for benefits. Qualified active-duty personnel can receive educational assistance under Chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code if they meet specific requirements. This includes having a high school diploma or equivalent certification and receiving an honorable discharge upon leaving active duty. Upon electing to receive basic educational assistance, the individual's basic pay will be reduced until a total reduction of $2,700 is reached. The qualified individual's basic pay will be reduced by $2,700 or their retired/retainer pay will be reduced by the difference between $2,700 and previous reductions. The Secretary will collect the amount due over an 18-month period after the individual's election. The Secretary will collect the amount due over an 18-month period after the individual's election, and no educational assistance allowance shall be paid until the amount is collected or retired/retainer pay is reduced. Notice of the opportunity to elect basic educational assistance will be provided by the Secretary in conjunction with the Secretary of Defense. The amendment includes changes to Section 3017(b)(1) of the title, adding references to new sections 3018D(c) for entitlement to educational assistance. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 30 of the title. Opportunity for certain active-duty personnel to enroll in educational assistance under Section 3018D.
